text: Dark beige head. Brown colour. Aroma is malty, fruity (raisins) with caramel and candy notes. Flavor is malty too with fruity (fig and dates) and licorice tones, ending in a moderately spicy and fruity finish. Medium bodied.
Tapp. Colacolored with nice head. Aroma and taste is caramel, dried dark fruits, burnt sugar and some wood. Bitter ending.

330ml bottle. Slightly cloudy, ruby-brown colour with average to huge, thick, creamy, slowly osteoporosing, moderately lacing, off-white to beige head. Fruity and dark malty aroma, notes of raisin, hints of treacle, a touch of liquorice, yeasty and hoppy overtones. Taste is minimally sweet, dark malty, slightly fruity and minimally woody, hints of dried fruit, raisin, a touch of liquorice, yeasty and hoppy overtones; soft palate, gentle but efficient carbonation.

75 cl bottle - bbd = August 2006 
Had developped very well. Full, complex and round taste.

33cl-fles in les Zythologie te Syntra Kortrijk. U: Helder bruin met dunne beige schuimkraag. G: Karamel, pure chocolade en gist. S: Zoet met wat moutbitterheid. Karamel, chocolade en gist. M: Redelijk volmondig met medium carbonatie.

the aroma is fruity and caramel with hints of vanilla, raisin, toffee, dried plum and bisquit... the taste is caramel and fruity with notes of toffee, raisin, dried plum, candy, bisquit and some spices... sweet, dry and bitter aftertaste...

Bottle. Pours opaque ruby red to mahogany. Medium bubly beige head that quickly deminishes. Good lacing. Smells of dried fruit. coffee, toffee, spicy yeast. Medium body. the flavour is semi-dry, malty and boozy. Dried fruit, chocolate. Fairly bitter harsh ending coming rather from alcohol than from hops. Not the best balance among its Belgian competitors. Could use some aging.
Caramel, roasted notes, earthy, copper with a good ocher head quite persistant, medium body, medium carbonation, taste is quite sweet with caramel again...very good and easy to drink dubbel.

33 cl. bottle poured in to a Tulip. Hazy, amber-red colour with a medium sized off-white head. Sweet aroma with fruits, yeasts, caramel, bread, floral and herbal hops. Taste is light sweet. Medium to full body with a creamy texture and a soft carbonation. Finishes slightly dry with dark, dried fruits, herbal and yeasty notes. As the beer warms up - some booze. Lovely Dubbel.

Bottle. Pours brilliantly clear tawny with a medium, frothy beige head, medium retention with good lacing. Aroma is heavy toast and cookie malt, nutmeg, dates and figs with light earthy and woody hops. Flavor is moderate toast and cookie malt, light notes of dark fruits, light earthy and woody hops and bitterness with a sweet finish. Full body and moderate carbonation.

UPDATED: DEC 8, 2016 Bottle. Brown color with tanned head. Aroma has yeast, malt, dark fruits, caramel and toffee. Taste is malty sweet with quite long a bit bitter aftertaste. Flavors of caramel, malt, yeast, vinegar and dark fruits.

Közepes, tartós hab, barna szín, szűretlen. Kandiscukros, karamelles illat. Karamelles, enyhén pezsgős, malátás íz. Közepesen testes, erősen, de nem zavaróan szénsavas, enyhén keserű. Nem jön be, valahogy nem elég fajsúlyos, talán érnie kellene még.

Clear light brown with a fat finger of head. Sweet malty aroma with characteristic fruity yeast. Surprising medicinal bitterness dominates followed by sweet malts and shortbread cookies. The black licorice remains and its not altogether pleasing. Pretty straightforward dubbel, but I personally prefer sweeter, less herbal examples. Not bad.

Hiányzott már egy klasszikus, sallangoktól mentes, cicomázatlan belga itóka, s arra is kénytelen voltam rádöbbenni, hogy a top 50-ben szereplő abbey dubbelhez eddig még nem volt szerencsém. Örülök, hogy végül mégiscsak lett, mert így azt is nyugtázhattam, hogy pár nagyvad után milyen jóleső érzés tud lenni egy-egy szimplán szolid főzet elkortyolgatása. Ennek az italnak is egyszerűségében rejlik ugyanis az ereje, a mindig örömteli élményt nyújtó rágógumis, élesztős, gyógynövényes felhőcskékben gesztenyebarna testére simuló krémes, tojáshéj színű habja fölött; majd a bársonyosan sima, mégis élénk, kerekded szerkezetbe ágyazott, tipikusan belga, diós és aszalt fügés, datolyás, kekszes és medvecukros színezetű ízjegyeiben. Nem túl hivalkodó, még a típusra általánosságban jellemző visszafogottsághoz képest is nyugodt karakterű, de jóleső ízvilágú, könnyen fogyasztható, finom főzet.

Backlog, Bottle, pours reddish brown with average head. Smell is flowers, candy malt, light hops, and pepper. Flavor is dried fruit, light coffee, and bread. I prefer the blonde but this is pretty nice. all things considered.

Deep red body with a two finger off white head. Smells banana,sweet malt,spice, dark fruits.The body is medium with perfect carbonation. It tastes sweet malt, dark fruits.Bitterness comes at the end of the sip as an aftertaste but it is welcome and discreet.A very complex beer both for food pairing and to be tasted alone.
Backlog, from bottle. Poured slight hazy Brown with a tanned head. Nose of caramel malts, light chocolate, Bread, spiced grains, cacao, sweet banana, cloves. Medium sweet aftertaste, earth tones

Jolie robe brune avec des reflets rubis surmontée dune mousse de couleur crème peu persistante avec une carbonatation moyenne.Le nez nous offre rapidement des notes vineuses et fruitées.La bouche nous amène sur des saveurs à limage du nez avec une agréable douceur mêlée à des pointes dacidité et damertume.Une Moinette bien équilibrée et chaleureuse!

Dégustée dans un verre Maredsous.
Température de début 10 à 11°.
Belle robe brun roux surmontée dune mousse beige clair assez persistante; faible carbonatation.
Nez agréable : vineux et fruité(raisins) avec une note de levure.
Goût également plaisant avec des touches fruitées, houblonnées et une imperceptible acidité bienvenue, le tout dans un bel équilibre.
En réchauffant un peu dautres saveurs(fruits rouges) apparaissent et font de cette bière un ensemble bien plus riche et complexe quil ny paraît de prime abord.
La finale de bonne longueur ajoute une appréciable douceur.
La Moinette est une bien jolie brunette.
16,5/20
Dark. Malty. Sweet. Little bit of bitterness. Alcohol. Not bad but not the best.

Dark brown, light yellowish head is quite small; scarce retention but good lacing. Aroma is malty (dough and toffee), with dark/dried fruit hints, not that intense. Taste is mostly sweet with just a hint of bitterness in the finish: again malty (dough) and yeasty with a hint of earthiness, background notes of liquorice and dark fruits. Alcohol is well hidden. Finish and aftertaste are also sweet and full. Medium body with medium to high carbonation; full mouthfeel, but not so creamy, as this kind of beer demanded. Overall ok and pleasant but not too impressive.

Bottle 33cl. Belle brune couleur cuivrée un peu trouble avec mousse blanche abondante. Arômes : caramel et chocolat. Bouche : agréable avec beaucoup deffervescence et des goûts de fruit agréables. Aroma and taste is fruity and malty, notes of dried fruit, yeast, caramel and treacle, sweet malty into the close.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Ftom tapat Taphouse. Hazy brown coloyr with an off-white head. Aroma and flavour of malt, hops, spice, yeast and fruit.

opalescent brown colour, one finger of creamy yellowish head; aroma of dried plum and sour cherry, some dark chocolate and biscuit notes; taste has the same notes as the aroma with some spicy notes; a bit watery, otherwise good dubbel
Bottle at the Hemelvaart Bier Café in Ayton. Hazy amber with a cream head. Bready aroma. The taste is quite sweet with lots of caramel and some peppery spice. Marmalade also. Nice.

0.75 bottle. Pours dark ruby color with medium, mostly lasting off-white head. Aroma of wood, wine, malts. Flavor is light to medium sweet, light bitter. Finish is medium long, medium bittersweet, somewhat dry with alcoholic warmth. Medium body, average carbonation.

UPDATED: AUG 26, 2016 Pours in dark brown colour with medium size brownish head. Aroma of caramel, chocolate, waffle. Highly sweet, medium bitter, no sourness. Full body, thick oily feel, strong burned like chocolate aftertaste.
Bottle, 330 ml at Craft Room, Zagreb. Pours dark amber with medium beige head. Caramel malty, yeast, dried fruit,spicy. Medium bodied. Sweet. Bit raw, lacks smoothness like Chimay Red.
Bottle.Dark amber colour with small white head.Aroma is malty and bready with taste of caramel and yeast,even slight hint of fruits,lively mouthfeels and toasted malty finish.

Po przelaniu do szkła tworzy się drobno i średnio oczkowa, obfita piana, dość trwała. Barwa rubinowa, opalizująca. Aromat słodki, średnio intensywny - sporo suszonych i kandyzowanych owoców, karmelu, miodu, troszkę ziół i przypraw. W smaku adekwatnie, jest słodycz i lekka kwaskowość (czy bardziej świeżość) moreli, gruszek, śliwek węgierek, kandyzowanych brzoskwiń, daktyli, rodzynek i fig. Jest nieco miodowo, karmelowo a na finiszu wyraźne zioła i przyprawy korzenne. Goryczka głogowa, może nieduża, ale pikantna. Piwo nie jest gęste, a przy takim bukiecie smakowym wydaje się nawet trochę wodniste, średnio nagazowane.
Dobry przykład wskazujący na różnice, pomiędzy klasowym Quadruplem a Dubblem - przy podobnej palecie aromatyczno smakowej ten drugi jest po prostu lżejszy, łatwiejszy w piciu, mniej zalepiający, jakby mdły... Chciałoby się rzec Dubbel to taki Quad na lato :)

Hazy brown pour with a thin beige head and light lacing .... Aroma is slightly sour and of dark fruity yeast, light roasted malts and caramel malts .... Taste is lightly sour with some tartness, dark fruits, light spicy hop, roasted malts and a little sweetness ... Has a dry lightly bitter hopped finish which also has a lingering tartness .... Sessionable and simple body is medium and its a little lively on the tongue

0.33 bottle.   A dark brown color with a crimson tinge and a huge, tanned head. Aroma of dark malts, dark fruits, some spices and sugar - not bad. A sweet, delicate taste - less fruity and more malty than the aroma. A light to medium body, a thin texture, and an average carbonation. Finish is short and somewhat watery. Not a bad beer, not a good one either - somewhat insipid.

Aroma:

Slight/medium aroma of malts, caramel, Belgian yeast, dried fruits, bread and nuts.

Appearance:

Turbid/opaque ruby/brown beer with medium yeast and with a slight/medium beige head.

Taste/Palate:

Starts medium sweet with malts, caramel, Belgian yeast and dried fruits; ends slightly bitter with bread and nuts.

Overall:

This beer is balanced with certain depth and a lot of character. The intensity of the aroma is miles behind the flavour however.

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2017 butelka, warka do 10/2017. Ladne, lekko opalizujace, wpadajace w wisniowy kolor, z nieco szampanska piana. Aromaty to na dziendobry bardzo duzo kwasnych, ciemnych owocow, do tego nieco winne, nieco gumy balonowej, nieco karmelowo-melasowej slodyczy. w ustach dosc slodkie, bardzo drobno w fakturze wysycone, dosc lekkie, nadal to co w aromatach, goryczka niewysoka, krzaczasta taka :) Super ukryty alkohol, w ogole po nim sladu nie ma. generalnie mam wrazenie, ze to nieco niedoceniony dubel, moze przez to, ze nieco odbiega od klasycznego podejscia? tak czy inaczej dla mnie bardzo fajny, sniadaniowy :)Ocena potraktowana skryptem do przeliczania ocen (uzgodnienie UT/RB).

Dark amber color with beige head. Aroma has dark malts, brown sugar and molasses. Taste starts yeasty with dark malts, just a hint of sugar sweetness and some dried fruits. Finishes quite bitter and earthy. Medium body and carbonation, well hidden ABV. Overall its a nice belgian dark ale. Although I am not a fan of this style, I enjoyed this one.

Aroma: peach, phenols, dried red fruits, dark malts.
Appearance: clear amber color and beige head.
Taste: roasted dark malts, red fruits, belgian phenols, zesty, peachy, warming alcohol, quite dry.
Palate: medium body and medium carbonation, roasted finish.
Overall: Really nice dubbel, complex and tasty.
330ml Flasche. Beaun-rotes Bier mit festem Schaum. Malz, Toffee und Rotwein Noten. Kräftiger schwerer Geschmack.

On tap @Bir&Fud (Rome). Pours deep amber/reddish with a medium and persistent white head. Aroma of malt, caramel, berries, toffee, yeasts. Flavour is medium to heavy sweet with a delicate bitterness. Medium body, medium carbonation. Good!

There are some beers that speak for themselves - This is one of them. This is lik a wine ale that takes you into the spring witha swig. It speaks whispers to you of flowers and craft, lulls you into the brushes to experience the sweetness of its path. A hell of a beer that you cannot seriously consider to not have drank as a beer taster.

Birra molto saporita e complessa, e allo stesso tempo di gran classe. Sentori predominanti di caramello, ciliegia, speziato, leggero liquoroso, ecc. Il tutto rende la birra tendente al dolce, ma allo stesso tempo abbastanza equilibrata, e comunque mai stucchevole. Ottimo lavoro!

33 cl bottle at home. Pours light brownish with big off-white head. Aroma: bread, grape, apple. Taste: medium sweetness with medium bitterness. A little sour. Notes of malts and green apple. Texture is thin. Carbonation is lively.

Pours dark amber/brown with a minimal white head. Fruity nose and the aroma of dry fruits, herbs, caramel and toast. Tastes malty sweet with a light bitter, dry and alcoholic finish. Very soft carbonation but full bodied. Good one.

It pours amber with a full head. It is mostly clear, the head is off white and takes a white to disappear. There are aromas of plums, apples, toast, cherries, and a bit of rose. It has flavors of toast and caramel with raisins, apple, and plums. It has a medium feel and has moderate carbonation. It has a dry finish with a touch of tart.

Cloudy dark brown color, small tan head. Dried fruit, some fig, berries, raisins. Medium to heavy sweet, begins little mild and then explodes. Creamy, medium to full body. Quite nice. //bottle at Craft Room

Decent brew, tho bit underpowered for good dubbel. Lovely malty background,
 some caramel, dried fruits, sugary, light herbal hops, bit spicy. Moderate to light sweetness, light bitterness. Decent, but nothing too fancy

Bottle from Beer Express. BB 09/2016. Gusher - had to do some cleaning up after opening the bottle. Pours very murky and full of bits despite the many weeks in the cellar. The aroma is very delicately sweet, caramel, candy, flowers, cinnamon, soaked raisins. Tastes along the same lines - cinnamon and vanilla biscuits, soft stone fruits, and a tingle of spice and alcohol in the finish. Soft in the mouth with a small but prickly carbonation. Overall a bit too sweet but very nice nonetheless.
UPDATED: FEB 20, 2017 Spændende velsmagende øl. Tilpas sød finish og aligevel let bitterhed i smagen. Flot farve og skum.
Bottle at Huis place. Nice chocolatey sweet brown sugary spiced brown. Pleasant drinking. Backlog from 2014/11/01.

At the Craft Room (thanks guys!). Dark amber-brown body. Corky, sweet aroma, raisins and dust, pungent and nice. Dry taste, raisins, slightly woody, slightly high carbonation. A touch of bitterness. A solid maltiess overall. No flaw really, but not brilliant. All in all, a good beer.
Bottle. Pours Dark Amber with a Beige head. Nice sweet and yeasty aroma. Caramel and berries. Nice and malty with a touch of booze and a plummy sweetness. Full flavoured. Very nice.

Robe brune reflets ambrés, belle mousse abondante. Nez marqué par des notes torréfiées, du caramel, un coté lacté. Bouche à lattaque fraîche, avec un coté doucereux, mais une belle amertume qui rééquilibre le tout en finale. Une bière dautomne

Murky cola color, frothy head. A: spicy, juniper berry, laurel, slight cherry booziness with dark chocolate note, roasted malts. T: gentle creamy mouthfeel, slightly boozy taste with cherry and choco notes. Vanilla bitter development. Sticky, dry aftertaste, some prune.
Een biologisch biertje van Dupont. Een krachtige doordringende smaak en goede schuimkraag.
Draught at Hemel. Rich raisin, dark cherry. Cocoa, mocha, dark fruit, mildly roasted, light whiske bite, dry finish. Not bad but maybe a little thin for such an abv.
Bruin bier met weinig schuim. Smaak is krachtig, licht zoet met spore van toffee, rozijn, aardbei en caramel. Best goed bier.
10/20/2006 4:09:56 AM Tap at Cafe Belgique. Wheat color. Very spicy Abbey Dubbel. head creamy. Oaky, bitter and spicy taste with a waft of honey. Very good.

Opaque red-brown colour with a lightly beige head. Aromas of mushy resins, dried fruits, herbal, alcoholaromatic, some light spice notes. Soft carbonation lightly slick, full bodied. Malty, dried fruity sweetness with a herbal tocuh offering light astringency and a hint of bitterness. Lasting herbal finish.

Colore ambrato carico, aspetto generale molto bello.
Odore di caramello e fruttato.
In bocca frizzantezza alta, corposa, sapore di malto caramellato, fruttato, ma ben equilibrato nel finale. Alcool non evidente.

Bottle from Beergium. Hazy brown color, beige head. Bitter taste with nuts, toffee, citrus, earthy notes, toast and hops. Bitter finish with nuts, toffee, hops, earthy notes and toast. Very nice belgian strong ale.

GIft from the tour at the brewery - Color: hazy amber caramel beer with no carbonation and small brown head. Smell: roasted malt, caramel, sweet and small coffee finish. Taste: very nice body, easy drinkable. Roasted malt and nuts notes. Good bitterness as well. Aftertaste: roasted malt and gingerbread. Good caramel and small coffee finish. Good bitternes.

33 cl bottle from Club de Cervezas. Pours a hazy brown color with a reddish hue and a massive soapy off-white head that diminishes slowly. Aroma is intensely fruity, yeasty and malty. Enticing notes of caramel, red apples, sour cherries, cranberries, red currants, raspberries, hazelnuts, aniseed and some white raisins. This is seriously complex and layered. Taste is sweet and intense. Some candy-sugar and caramel sweetness can be felt at times coupled with all the big "red" fruitiness. Im sure some folks might find this one too-sweet. Yeah, maybe a little bit too much. With just a tiny bit of tartness for balance it would be worldclass. Big bodied, it feels thick and heavy in the mouth. This one is a well-made Dubbel... but after drinking the whole bottle on its own, I found a few flaws in the overt sweetness. I can just imagine how great it would be as a Sour. Maybe its a beer to pair with food only. Stand alone, it deserves a 3.8.

Presenta marrón oscuro con pequeña cabeza de espuma, perdurando una fina capa hasta el final, aromas a caramelo, azúcar Candy, frutos rojos y uvas pasas, en boca entrada media con ligeras notas picantes, amargor muy sutil con final dulce, cuerpo y carbónico medios en una correcta cerveza doble.

33cl bottle from SIP veini- ja õllepood, Tallinn. Pours slightly hazy brow with an off-white head. Aroma of caramel, dark dried fruits, Belgian yeast, some herbs and some slightly earthy notes and hints of alcohol. Fairy sweet, but balanced enough, rather tasty, but alcohol is a bit to noticable as it gets warmer. Nice one anyway.

1991 bottle at akkurat. This vintage is amazingly good. Super clear mahogony color with a small off white head that quickly fades away. The aroma of this beer!! Amazing! Tons of caramel, toffee, yeast, old musty cellar, caramelized figs. The flavour is on top as well, pretty much all the things you get in the aroma you get in the taste with the most well balanced flavour and complexity Ive ever had. Holy beer this.

Bottle from Tanakaya. Poured into a Liefmans glass. Clear dark brown with a small head that dissipated fairly quickly. Nice dupont yeast smell on the nose with some prune, praline, molasses and caramel aromas present. Slight cola-like mouthfeel with average carbonatin and a medium body. Nice fruit forward beer thats sweet on the palate. Nice finish that has a touch of dryness but is overall sweet. Definitely prefer their drier beers, but this is OK for the style.

F: riche frothy tan head diminishing to long lasting thin cover.
C: cloudy dark red/bruin amber.
A: some dry earthy hoppy combined with nice fruity aroma.
T: sour sweet caramel malt taste with dry hop palate bitterness, dry mouthfeel, earthy, dust, spicy, nutty yeast tones with some fruity like blueberries, light to medium body, average carbonation, interesting abbey dubbel very drinkable but beware of ABV.
Dark brown with rich yellow head. Aroma of roasted caramel, same it the taste in the mixture with fruity yeast notes. MIld bitterness on backround, says in the aftertaste.
0,75 l bottle. Thick cap. Dark, cloudy. Hoppy taste, with strong caramel taste, that stays alao as aftertaste.

Bonito color castaño, turbia. Dos dedos de espuma muy efervescente. Aroma ligero a malta. Cuerpo ligero y carbonatación notable, Agradable sabor a caramelo y malta tostada, con algo de chocolate. Final algo plano, ligeramente especiado.
Aroma of caramel, malt, spices, herbs. At the beginning the taste is sweet like a caramel but after a while it turns into bouquet of spices, malt and bitter hops. Great beer

Flaska från beernavigator. En något år gmmal flska. Coca cola-färgad, klar, lågt skum. Söt doft av russin, madeira, torkade körsbär och tranbär och karamell. Söt och fruktig men viss beska finns kvar från humlen och balanserar något. Fina smaker av russin och annan torkad frukt, viss madeiraisering. Trevlig dubbel.

Fra flaske på RBHD-samling på Fridtjofen april-15: rødgylden med hvitt skum som varrer. Mørke karameller, overmodne bær og halvvisne blomster i aroma og smak. Halvtørr. Et delikat understatement innen stilen.

Shared 330 ml bottle at local tasting. Brown colour, off-white head. Moderate aroma, hints of brown kandij sugar and herbs. The flavour is more defined, brown kandij sugar without being too sweet, herbs and hops. Nice enough.

0,33 l flaske delt på RBHD-treff på Fridtjoffen april 2015. Fikk slutten, så det kom med en del gjærrester. ratingen er basert på dette. Søtlige gjærtoner i nesa med kandissukker og litt bær. I munnen er den kraftig søt med en balanserende bitterhet. Mynnen er fyldig og litt alkovarm med en deilig ettersmak.

UPDATED: MAY 8, 2015 Shared bottle at RB/HD on board Fridtjofen 14.04.15. Deep orange. Small, beige head. Aroma of sweet, semi-dark malt and ripe fruit. Similar taste. Hints of herbs. Good drinkability.

Shared bottle at RBHD tasting. Pours hazy deep golden with a big creamy white head. Aroma is shy malty, bread with some yeast. Taste is moderate sweet bready and toffeeish malts, with a good dry spicy and herbal finish. High carbonated, pleasant beer.

Pours a dark brown body with a medium head. Nice and fresh malty aroma. Nice taste but full of metal tones 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Perhaps the best Abbey Dubbel I have ever tried. Very nice aroma with hops, caramel and chocolate. Very well balanced and soft combination of aromas.

330 ml bottle. Strong alcohol smell, but soft in the others. I can sense caramel and some coffee. Dark amber color with a creamy little white head that quickly fades, even if you move the glass appears again. Dense complex taste, not has alcoholic has expected from smell. Taste of grains and just a little tiny bit of cherry. Very bitter taste, not balanced at all, not a pleasent feeling. Good beer, you can tell that is well made, but im just not crazy about it.
Darkly beautiful, sweet malts well balanced with herbal some resinous hops.
Een bijzondere dubbel. Lichte houtsmaak, koffie, hop. Tevens graan. Mooie schuimkop.

Medium light brown mokka head, dark brown colour, metal dark caramel sweet smell, medium high carbonation medium bitter warm dark fruits herby malts some chocolat taste some ice cream like mouth feeling

Hazy copper with a thin lacy lasting frothy reminiscing head. Smells of deep toasted malt, caramel, and candy brown sugar with soft Belgian yeast. Initial taste of sweetness with candy sweetness but softened bitterness in the middle overall with a fruity grape and pepper finish. Lots of caramel and toffee. Very nice dubbel.
Beer on tap in Malesicky mikropivovar. Belgium strong ale, maybe too much koliandr for me
Bottle at Craigs. Pours copper brown, nose is sugary, caramel, taste is light fruit, aniseed, toffee.

Im a great fan of Brasserie Dupont, specially of its saison, and I expected crear things from Moinette. Well, its not a bad beer at all, but I prefer many others into the style. This one is very correct, well brewed, with a red wine touch that enhances the overall with a slightly acid nuance. Good beer.
Bottle. Pours a brown/ copper, massive head that is the lightest of brown-white. , lots of lacing flecks. Nose is sweet malt, a little tart. Tastes sweet, sugary, boozy, yeasty. Decent.

Aroma: caramel, toffee, grain and bread malts, molasses. Appearance: clear, dark brown, small to no head. Taste: light sweet. Palate: sweets continue, get somewhat dry, heavy caramel and grain malts, bitter finish, lively carbonation. Overall: decent Abbey Dubbel, quite subtle in aroma. Bottle from Beers of Europe, Kings Lynn.

Excellent beer as can be expected from Dupont. It is a rich full beer yet not too heavy. Full of flavor still easy to drink. Nice hazelnut brown with a small head and pleasant carbonation. Flavor is complex with sour notes., hop bitterness, spices and lots of overripe fruit. Some citrus and melon.
In paultje van tap. Prima kleur, dun schuim. Ruikt beetje muf maar niet vies. Prima, maar wederom niet heel speciaal
Lichte chocolade bruine kleur met een volle kraag. Ruikt mout, kruiden, iets fruit. Smaakt chocolade, vanille. Beetje kruiden, bitter.

Bottle. Pours a fairly clear reddish brown color with a moderate tan head on there. Some caramel, dark fruit, and candy notes come through in the nose for me. Taste is light and sweet, almost like a pie. Not too bad.

33cl flesje via bierenzo.nl
Alcoholpercentage van 8,5%
Uitgeschonken in Grimbergen glas

Uiterlijk: hazelnootbruin met snel wegtrekkende schuimkraag

Aroma en smaak: zoet, caramel, donker fruit, licht kruidig

Conclusie: aparte dubbel, even wennen de geur en de eerste slokken, wordt steeds lekkerder

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Light brown with nice reddish hue and creamy off white head. Sweet malts and brown sugar, chocolate pudding, raisins and marzipan. Nice spices and light fruity bitter finish. Very good Belgian brown.

Veillie : bue à 3 mois de sa date limite. Belle couleur brune cuivrée, trouble, mousse blanche abondante et "bulleuse" mais disparaissant totalement assez vite. Nez complexe de malts grillés, caramel, herbes séchées, chataignes, épices. Bouche sur le caramel, les marrons, le malt et les épices, houblons herbeux bien présents. Amertume moyenne mais relativement importante quant au style et au vieillissement de la bière. Franchement très bon et dans mes souvenirs bien meilleurs que la même non veillie. Je conseille de loublier à la cave... La brasserie Dupont est décidemment une valeur sûre !

Bottle from de Bierschuur in Poppel. The beer has a dark red to brown color and a nice cream colored head, with a lot of bubbles. The aroma has a rich palate of herbs, roasted malts, hops and dark fruits. The taste is full and round with clear tones of the malts and hops. The finish slightly sweet by the dark fruits and also has a light bitterness by the hops. A very nice brune, I like another one.

330ml bottle poured in a chalice.
A: Pours a dark amber color and a medium yellow head that dissipates quickly leaving no lacings
S: Nose is sweet and fruity. Grapes and caramel. Candy sugar, caramel malts, Belgian yeasts, earthy hops
T: Follows the nose. A sweet upfront of dark fruits, candy sugar and roasted caramel malts. Bready and a bit metallic. Earthy hops. In overall a bit mild sweet beer with an also moderate bitterness
M: Medium body and carbonation. Balanced sweet-biterness and a it molasses sensation
O: Nice Dubbel. Good drinkability. Dupont quality
[ BA Review @ 3/17/2012 ]
A flowery aroma. I was surprised to find out that I tasted some sweet, ripe melon in the beer. Also some thyme is noticible. A light bitterness in the aftertaste.

330 ml bottle 
Appearance: Cloudy hazy amber brown colour with a small head of allmost 1 finger. It does leave some lacing.
Aroma: Caramelised malts, Phenoland a hint of banana, vanilla.
Taste:Medium sweet, Good caramel but not going too sweet, light roasted malts and hints of grass and light herbal notes, finish is slightly more sweet. with a hint of dark fruits.and alcohol.
medium body, average carbonation.

Interesting, because of the balance, I found it pesonallyt a bit too mild. But interresting enough to be picked up.

[5764-20130905] 330mL bottle. Toasted malt grains aroma. Murky, dark red orange body with a quick foamy off-white head. Bitter boozy toasted malt flavour. Medium body. Odd metallic grains. (6/3/6/3/13) 3.1-

Strongly phenolic, lightly estery nose, malty with notes of toast / bread and brown apple. Creamy and soft in the mouth, lively carbonation, savory, a little salty, finish of toasted grain and something akin to nutmeg spice. Rich textural experience, highly effervescent but not at all bracing. A light burn of alcohol in the finish at 8.5%, but it has good depth.

330ml bottle from Vanuxeem. Pours a deep brown with off white head. Aroma is strong caramel malts. Taste is deep, dark and fruity with lots of dried fruits, smooth malts, caramel, fudge and molasses. As normally expected from Dupont this is an exceedingly drinkable, flavoursome bruin.

Massive ale version of Moinette, with thick and firm, off-white head; aroma quite complex, fruity, some saison-like yeastiness and barnyard, dark malts; malty taste, dried fruits, yeasty spiciness, warming alcohol in the finish. Quite complex, much harder to find than the blonde one, but another great ale of one of my favorite Wallonian breweries.

330ml bottle from Appellation Wines, courtesy of AshtonMcCobb, thank Ash! Pours kinda clear, but with a chunky amount of floaters from the off, was a near-gusher. Clear copper, except for the thousands of black bits floating around. If the head hadnt stayed around, it would have been a 2 from me. (Sorry for sounding like an X-factor judge there). Aromas are red fruit, Belgian yeast, caramel. Taste is more of the same, with spice coming out a bit more. Medium body, oily to slick texture. Lingering spice finish. Builds nicely.
Een lekker donker bier met veel smaak aan zoals het hoort te zijn. De blond is wel nog beter vind ik

330 ml bottle bought at Gorgeous Wine & Cigar in Yuen Long.
Looks: Cloudy hazy amber brown colour with thin trace of yeast sediments; Half-finger head and off- white foam which fades in 40 seconds; Very good sticky lacing with notable slight carbonation.

Aroma: Slightly fragrant amber malt, with light roastyness, light banana, vanilla, caramel, molasses, Bel yeast and light phenolics.

Taste: Medium sweet malt, with light roastyness, very strong caramel, thick molasses, very light alcohol, hint of dark fruits, Bel yeast, lime, moderate bitter hops and sharp grass.

Body: Medium. Quite thick and slick palate.

Mouth Feel: Good amber maltyness with just enough roasty taste. Caramel dominates, really good molasses and hidden booze for loveable sweetness, dark fruit ester is very low but tastable. Yeasty with bits of spiciness. Simple but subtle.

Hoppiness: No aroma; Lime, sharp grass and light spice in taste. Bitterness is quite notable for a Dubbel for an abrupt, well-balanced bitter-sweet finish.

After Taste: Slightly dry. Malty, roasty and hoppy to mouth.

Comments: As a supposedly top Dubbel, this one is a bit simple, somewhat empty, with too few esters and taste varieties. Yet its well-malted and roasted, with almost all other tastes are well amplified. Solid, but cant beat my favorite Chimay Red and Westmalle Dubbel.
Bottle at Hiranoya. More fruity than I remember, dark fruit, raisins, plums, yeasty. Sweetness, great stuff. Toffee. Yum.

UPDATED: JAN 17, 2017 Flasche (33 cl). - Etwas stumpfes Braunrot, trüb. - In der Nase die unverkennbare Dupont-Hefe, milder Mokka mit erdigem Einschlag, vornehme obergärige Fruchtigkeit. - Im Antrunk das typische Dupont-Aroma. Röstmalzig-würzig, vornehm herb-fruchtige Orangenbittere, zarte modrige Kellernote. Mild rezent, weich im Mund. Trockener, krautig-hopfenherber, erdiger Abgang. - Großartiges Brune. Da ist nichts von der plumpen, einfallslosen bananigen Süße mancher belgischen Biere, alles ist vielschichtig und spannungsgeladen. Eigenwillig, erdig-derb und doch vornehm, perfekt ausbalanciert. Schmeckte mir sogar noch besser als Moinette Blonde, obwohl Röstmalz und Dupont-Hefe nicht völlig reibungslos harmonieren.
33cl bottle thanks to ruigo. Color is dark brown/dark orange. Head is thin. Medium to low sweetness. Aroma is caramel, wood, sugar, malt.

0,33L bottle, BB 09.2015. Pours dark amber with off-white head. The head stays. Aroma is caramel, brown sugar, dark fruits, apples, and yeast. Taste is malt, yeast, dark fruits, caramel, and some alcohol. Finish is fruity bitter with some alcohol. Overall: very enjoyable, but alcohol is a little bit too obvious.

Bu en bouteille de 75cl, belle bière brune ambrée, grosse mousse blanche très intense et une effervescence très violente. En bouche attaque sur le caramel et le pruneau prégnance sur le grillé en fin de bouche mais effervescence trop forte voire désagréable.

A lovely Belgian brown this. Had to have two as the Obelix burger took a while at Comics Café. A nice malt that leans towards the sweet and not as bitter or sour as I first thought. Good dinner companion.

33 cl / 330 ml, flaske, 8,5 % ABV, gave fra Michele og Gert - tak! 10. maj 2014. 
Ufiltreret rødbrun Bruine med minimal offwhite skumtop på et par mm. 
Ikke kraftig duft, men noter af tørret frugt og gær-ditto efter eftergæringen på flasken. 
Smagen er mere bitter, end jeg regnede med. Sødmen er der, men den spiller 2. violin. 
Kuldioxid'et er på medium niveau.

average frothy offwhite head. good lacing. mostly diminishing. clear thick orangeish-brown body. aroma: moderate malty, caramel, toffee, butter and alcohol. if: moderate sweet. ff: moderate sweet bitter; long duration. palate: medium body, oily texture, lively carbonation, moderate alcoholic finish. Dulçor maltado, caramelado. Forte aquecimento alcoólico. Dubbel clássica, bem feita. Amargor de casca de fruta, lembra a de limão, sem ter a acidez nem o azedume do mesmo. 90 s
Belgian brown beer, but its Dupont so it has some nice dry and grassy herbs in it. Good tasty beer.
Bottle sampled at Cafe Buitenlust, Oirschot. Nice dark brown colour....smell and taste malts...a bit sweet...brown sugar...nice dubbel

Bottle (330 ml). Gusher. Slightly hazy amber brown with a small ring of off-white foam and little to no lacing. Aroma is spicy with herbal notes, malt/caramel and fruits/berries. Taste is slightly sweet and slightly/moderately spicy with malt/caramel, fruits/berries and a light alcohol warming. Medium body. Lively carbonation at first, but it become low carbonation after a few minutes. Dry and spicy finish. Not bad at all, but the gusher + weird carbonation tell me theres probably a little something wrong with this one. Still a quite tasty Belgian.
On tap at Biercab. Brown colour with off-white head. Yeast, dark fruits aroma. Dark fruits, caramel, roasted and yeast taste, sweet malt. Medium body.

Bottled. Pours hazy dark amber in color with an off-white head. Sweet ripe dark fruityness in aroma. Sweet maltyness, bit of yeasty spicyness in taste. Feels a bit dull on the whole as this brew didnt offer much neither in aroma or tastewise. Even a bit boozy towards the finish.
Draft. Extremely sweet and raisiny, no dryness, no hops, just waves of caramel and dark fruit with a touch of yeast.

Beautiful looking beer, excellent lacing, reddish-brown with a large off-white head. Aroma has some caramel, brown sugar and dried fruit. Really nice. Palate is a bit thin for the style, medium-bodied. Heavy-ish on the sweetness and light bitterness. Tastes different than it smells. Alcohol is much more evident than in the Blonde.

Amber haze. Two finger foam. Spicy yeasty. Dry bitter. Caramalty. Fine. The recommendation were a bit too good.

Malty aroma of brown sugar, dark fruits, yeast, caramel, raisins. Flavour is sweet malt, brown sugar. All things considered this has a surprisingly moderate/medium sweetness, with some lingering bitterness in the aftertaste.

Ins Glas ergießt sich ein trübes rötlichbraunes Bier mit schöner Schaumkrone. Geruch nach getrockneten Früchten, Hefe, Karamell.
Geschmack hefig, Karamell, Früchte, leicht gewürzig.

AROMA: resin, bread, herbs, 
APPEARANCE: amber, clear, frothy, white foam, 
TASTE: light sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour, 
PALATE: medium body, thin feel, lively, astringent, long finish, 
OVERALL: good saison, nice balance of tastes, subtle aromas.

Clean dark amber reddish color, small white head. Aroma of caramel, malt, tart, spice and dry apples. Taste has similar notes, mostly dry with light sweetness and mild roasty bitterness in finish. Light to medium body and lively carbonation. Nice beer, quite drinkable.
Bottle at home ,cloudy brown, smooth light brown head. Aroma is spicy, belgian yeasty. Dry malty. Flavor is spicy,malty,belgian yeasty, sweet spicy notes with hints of dried fruits.

750ml bottle. Pours out a amber topped with a tan head. Nose is belg yeast candy sugar and lots of bubbles. This baby was a gusher for sure. Taste is as the nose with lots of sweetness and belg yeast. Not bad for $5.99

Bottle at Akkurat. Pours dark hazy amber with a small off-white head. Aroma is dark sugar, dried fruits, belgian yeast spices. Taste is mid sweet dark sugar with a light bitterness, spicy and a touch of fruits as well. Medium body.

Bottle, 33cL. Home. A mahogany beer with orange hues through the light. Large white thin foam, medium lasting. Aroma of herbs, fruits (red berries), spices, bread. Short refreshing bitterness balanced with medium sweetness. Medium body, (too) thin texture. Good carbonation. Bittersweet finish. Warming. Overall, a very good beer I could share with a dear friend.
330ml bottle. Hazy copper color. Small size, off-white head, stays. Caramel, raisins, alcohol, yeasty aroma. Alcohol, dead yeast, malts, caramel in taste. Alcohol is strong in this one.

750 ml bottle. Non stopper gusher - 1 point. Pours brown with full head, suspended sediment and lots of carbonation. Aromas of yeast, toast, brown sugar candy, and apples. Flavors of burnt sugar, toast, with some fruit and spice. flat bitter finish. Not very impressive.

Small bottle. Cloudy orange/amber body, almost transparent. Small head. Aroma has yeasty phenols and some bread. Also nuts. Taste has fruit bread and some yeast. Way too thin and light in colour to be a proper Abbey Dubbel. Generic fruity/yeasty Belgian Ale but not an Abbey Dubbel in my opinion.
Dark amber body with almost no foam. Aroma has fruits, dried plums, licorice, raisins, light vanilla. Taste is medium to high sweet with low bitterness. Full body with no carbonation.

Brown reddish colour. Smell: sourness, sugar, dried plums. Taste: malts, sweetness, bitterness, alcohol and a dry ending. Not what you would expect, knowing the smell and the colour of the beer. Not bad at all.

Bottle (750ml): clear, deep copper and yellow head. Spice herbal lift. Clean but with a funky leesy edge. Caramel malt. Yeast lees. Slightly sour ginger spice aromatics. Off dry to slightly sweet. Slightly sour notes nod moderate bitterness. Medium to full bodied. Long. High CO2. Funky malty palate. Hops on the finish. 
Like a cross between a Flemish brown and an Abbey ale. The weight is more like an abbey. 
Complex. Good not great

Bottle. Pours hazy reddish-brown with a medium off-white head. Sweat malty aroma with lots of yeast and light spice notes. Sweet malt flavor with lots of yeast notes, caramel, and dark fruits. Hints of alcohol in the finish.

33 cL bottle into and Affligem glass at home. Red-brown with a fleeting bubbly head. Lightly sweet and spiced aroma. Dry, malty, smooth and lightly spiced. A smooth and tasty beer, nothing flash, but enjoyable.

33cl bottle at Onder de Ooievaar. Hazy brown with a medium off-white head. 
 Medium sweetness with some bitter notes. Dark fruits, caramel, hints of chocolate and honey. Usualy Im not a big fan of dubbels, but this one was quite nice.

33cl bottle, bb 10/15. Red brown color, white head. Sweet bready aroma, dark fruity notes, mild sourness, spicy notes. Inviting aroma. Flavor has spices, caramel, dates, clove and sweetness. Finish is long and quite sweet with alcohol warmth and fruity notes. One of the better dubbels I have had. High drinkability.

33 cl. bottle sampled @ De Stroopop in Zoersel. BBF 02/2015. Murky reddish fox brown with almost no tanned head. Nose is slightly tart with plenty of prunes, touch liquorish, berries, syrup, touch molasses, pretty interesting & fine stuff. Taste is slightly tart red berries, syrup, prunes, liquorish, quite a bit of cranberry sauce, fruity, pears, faintly tart in the back. Touch sticky mouthfeel, little carb. Pretty interesting & lovely stuff.
Déguster en bouteille 33cl. Plus compliquée à trouver que la blonde mais tout aussi intéressante. À trouver d'urgence !
Thick creamy brown. Thick head, lots of small bubbles. I prefer less carbonation. Smooth tasting, nice palette. Better when warmed up, flavor comes out.

2006 vintage. Thanks to KyotoLefty. Sweet, fruity aroma, with light brown sugar, and slight oxidation. Hazy copper color. Thick sugary sweetness in initial / the fruit has mellowed over time but still has a surprising tang (stewed pears, peaches), which remains even in the finish. Medium body. This has aged incredibly well.

6 year old bottle shared at Tadgs a cloudy honey brown pour with a boozy honey aroma. Everyone thought honey was in this beer, the taste was an incredibly rich honey caramel, figs, plums, a super smooth wallonian dubbel.

Pours a clear burnt orange colour with a short lived fizzy white head. The aroma candied oranges, mustiness, dark fruit, desk drawer, yeast. The flavour also had the candied oranges which is a underlying sweetness throughout, with some floral and herbal hops ontop, and a dry bitterness in the finish. Solid dubbel for sure.

33 cl bottle @ home. Pours reddish brown with a tiny bit of sediment and an off-white head that leaves some lacing. Aroma and flavour is red berries, sugar, yeast, and caramel  with a slightly dry finish.
bottle. Brownish-red colour, small head. Esters, yeast, berries, some pepper/spice. Mostly sweet. Decent.

Bottle @ De Paas. Pours a semi clear, headless brown beer. Aroma of red fruits, light caramel and slight chocolate. Flavour is medium sweet, fruity and touches of chocolate malts. Not overly impressive, nothing bad about it, nothing extraordinary good either.

bottle @ corso ADB 2013. NON E UNA DUBBEL!!! ambrata, riflessi marroncini. schiuma beige abbastanza fine ed abbastanza persistente. profumo fruttato dolce, di lievito belga, lieve erbaceo, alcolico. gusto meno complesso dei profumi, dolce, caramellato, di frutta candita. Luppolatura solo accennata. Corposa, poco carbonata, è una birra abbastanza equilibrata e tutto sommato armonica.
amber, orange, cloudy, caramel, roasty, woody, medium body, sticky, average carbonation, bitter, medium sweetness, medium bitterness,
amber, cloudy, rocky head, bread, roasty, herbs, earthy, medium sweetness, lightly sour, medium body, thin feel, lively,

Bottle. Brown, murky (happened to tilt the bottle, so the sediments got a bit stirred). Quite a lovely honey-malty, slight meadowy, hazelnutty nose. A bruine for sure, but nicely fresh and mellow. Dried rye bread-malty flavour. A lot of belgian yeast flavours & some estery. Really tasty., A bit too dry imho though, and sharp, with a mouthdrying finish. Could have more residuals, but really tasty like this too.
It is perfectly balanced in bitterness and sweetness. It is easy to drink but plenty notes and tastes that makes it unique!

750ml bottle, shared with Alicia. Cork on this one says "2012", cool. Fresher than the 2010 Blonde I just sampled prior to this. Hazy dark red, sort of brown color. Thin, sort of bubbly off-white head. Good retention. Couple splotches of lace. Smooth, soft, kind of stronger carbonation. More dry finish. Some dark fruit, brown sugar. Hint of honey. Moderate bitter taste, light sweet, moderate spice in the taste, some banana in the flavor. Head eventually fades to minimal. Enjoyed this much more than the Blond version.
Bottle. Hazy copper color with a thick foamy light brown head. Aroma of yeast, raisin, sherry, herbs, berries. Sour, bitter and sweet taste. Sour and bitter finish. Dry texture. Medium body.

UPDATED: SEP 27, 2015 33cl bottle, 75cl on former occasions. Geers. The slightly less spectacular sister of Moinette Blonde, still a very enjoyable reddish abbey dubbel/brune with some similarity to Chimay Rouge: caramel broken up by a typical dry and earthy saison yeast and complenting earthy-herbal hops, creating an almost light mouthfeel and moderate complexity. Happily revisit, if not as often as the superb Moinette Blonde. // Rerate 75cl bottle bb11/2015: quite cassonade-sweet, honey, saturated yet lightly drinkable like a 8,5% Walloon table beer.

Brune plus ou moins claire voilée, sédiments en supension; pétillance moyenne, mousse beige persistante. Malts caramel légèrement torréfiés, notes de menthe, dépices et de lun ou lautre fruits foncés. La Brasserie Dupont est définitivement un gage de qualité!

bottle @ bierhuiske
pours brown 
small white head
no smell 
taste is somewhat caramel (from the malts) sweet finish is more intence than the taste. good carbo . very very low taste . some chocolate notes, some earthyness...

2013-09-05. Hazy dark amber nice creamy off-white head. 3+ Aroma is sweetly malty, moderate sugar and Belgian yeast character. 7+ Flavour is similar, sweet sugary malt, notes of caramel and brown sugar, mdoerate Belgian yeasty esters, good amount of alcohol presence is warming but not over powering. Smooth average plus body and moderate carbonation is pleasantly soft. Not amazing but pretty solid and enjoyable take on the style. Bottle from the LCBO, Toronto

33cl bottle.
APPEARANCE: clear brown/amber beer, small unstable off white head.
NOSE: caramel, sweet, grains.
TASTE: caramel, sweet, alcohol.
Nice!

Pours a creamy off-white head that mostly diminishes. Body is hazy red brown.
Aroma contains moderate malts (cookie, cereal, caramel), light hops (citrusfruits), light yeasts (barnyard) and grape, raisin, pineapple, cherry, cassis, forest fruits/red fruits and cola. 
Flavor starts off light acidic, then light sweetness is added and finish is light bitter.
Body is medium with creamy texture and soft carbonation.
It's fruity and tasteful. Not extraordinary, but I like it.
Lots of malty caramel and dried fruits here. Very sweet and somewhat spiced on the finish. Very nice beer.
Pours clear amber/brown with a off-white head. Aroma has notes of malt, caramel, chocolate and dried fruits. Taste is medium sweet and light bitter.
Pours hazelnut brown with velvet off white top. Aroma is bready yeast with spice and faint nut. Taste is carbonated, light yeast and light nut.

330ml bottle. Pours a clouded, dark amber with an effervescent head that fades to nothing quickly. Smell has notes of apple, banana, yeast, spice, and a hint of alcohol.Taste is a touch sweet with notes of yeast and fruit.Low to medium carbonation. Slightly bubbly texture. Medium body with a sweet/spiced after taste. A solid brew. Would buy again to change it up.
Couleur de cuivre ou peut-étre marron avec un grand col beige. Larôme de levure, malt, et fruits noir (comme les rasins sec). Un goût légèrement sucré, des fruits, du caramel. Très effervescente.

33 cl. bb 03/2015. Translucent copper-brown with a half inch of foam. Mild aroma of flowery caramel and a touch of chocolate. Flavors of oxidized apple, toffee, dark bread, pith, cocoa and toasted walnut. Medium body is a little too fizzy, but well balanced.
750 ml. corked and caged bottle. Pours light brown with a foamy white head. Carbonation is high. Aromas od dried dark fruit, brown sugar and malts. Semi-sweet finish.

Hazy orangish brown pour with a ton of head. The head faded pretty quick, its still there but not nearly as impressive as upon first pour.

Very weak aroma, surprising for the amount of head. Plumbs and dark fruits. The mouth is much lighter and very pleasant. Lighter fruits and lots of herbs. Clove. A bit sweet. Very very easy to drink. For a strong beer its not right in your face. Man this tastes great. Flowery. Malty sweet caramel finish. 

Dark bitter fruit scent, followed by sweet fruit tastes finishing in a caramel maltiness. Man what a journey. Amazing balance.

Best beer so far tonight, and Im guessing Im not going to find one better for some time.
Drunk with Brian, in 2 ways. I definitely prefer dark Belgians when Im pissed. I was pissed. Deja vu? Feels so good now Im back in your system.

Bottle 330 ml 
Aroma: frontal tartness followed by phenolic blend of red apple and Hungarian plums. Some sugary sweetness at end but not cloying. 8- 
Look: slight haze on amber with lighter fizzy top. 
Taste and palate: soft with mild carbonation. Refined fruity sugars as base. Almost zero of harshness. This was not rushed at all. Alcohol superbly covered. This is how you make dubbel ladies and gentlemen.

Refrigerated 75 cl brown bottle capped and corked poured into a tulip.  Pours translucent medium brown with crimson hues big beige head.  Good small bubble lacing, medium body, medium carbonation, and dark fruit aroma.  Taste is some dark fruit up front finishes really earthy.  Not one of my favorite dubbels, but may be the bottle was old.

Pours cloudy brown with good head and lacing. Has nice floral aroma with some booze. Taste has some malt. I thought this would be more sweet, but its a well-balanced dubbel. Carbonation a little fizzy. Finishes bittersweet. Bottle from lcbo.
Bottle from LCBO.  Pours clear brown with a thin head.  Aroma is sweet  and roasty, with caramel and grapes.  Taste is sweet grapes, roasted notes, caramel, with a dry olive finish.  Feels flat.

Bottle at Pub Edward. Slightly muddy brown pour with thin white head. Aroma is quite roasty, lots of earthy, tannic roasty malts, toasted grain and phenolic yeast notes; not unpleasant but a bit surprising. Taste is malty, roasted grain, slight tannic finish, earthy. Palate is med-full bodied and slightly undercarbed. Decent, but obviously not Duponts forte.

Single small bottle from the LCBO with a best before date of 10/2015 on back label. Pours an amber colour with lots of real tiny particles floating around, which seems to make this one hazy, but very, very lightly. Foamy light beige head with decent retention, but not much lace. The alcohol kind of gives a chlorine-pool aroma mixed-in with soda water, at first. Then, it changes for the better with notes of red apples, brown sugars and light spices. The taste is well-represented this way as well with a herbal finish. It does become quite hazy at the last pour. The alcohol is overall, well-hidden with no burning. A decent blend of fruitiness, sweetness and spices, but not really my thing.

330ml bottle 
8.5% ABV 
King/Spadina LCBO Outlet (Toronto, Ontario, Canada) 
May 1, 2013 
Part of the Spring 2013 LCBO Dupont feature.  The beer pours a semi-translucent light reddish-brown with a thin bubbly whitish head.  The aroma is yeast, dark fruits, and funk.  The mouthfeel is light to medium bodied with average carbonation.  The flavour is tart fruit and funky yeast with a little malt sweetness.  I expected more.

330ml bottle. A cloudy dark orange body, small beige head with good retention, but almost no lacing. Aroma of yeast, autumn leaves, herbs, some woodiness, sour cherry. Taste of yeast and lambic sourness, plenty of spices, brown sugar, herbs, noticeable hop presence closer to the end, same woodiness. Im not too sure if this is a dubbel.

330 mL bottle.  Pours a hazy reddish brown with a thin white head.  On the nose, rich nutty caramel malts, yeast and spice bread.  Herbal and almost woody with a slightly sour yeasty bite. Malty and well rounded with a touch of sweetness and a bitter finish. High carbonation and a full oily mouth feel. Painfully yeasty, could have been the pour.

the nose on this is great- really herbacious and malty- good complexity. the colour is also very nice. the palate however is way light. theres not much going on at all for a belgian dubbel. maybe im expecting too much.

Bottle. Moderate cookie note for the malt, orange for the hops, dough for the yeast with brown sugar in the background. Head is average size, frothy, off-white with no lacing and is almost fully diminishing. Color is muddy medium brown. Flavor starts moderately sweet and acidic, then finishes lightly sweet and lightly to moderately bitter. Palate is on the fuller side of medium, a little slick with a fizzy carbonation and a slightly dry finish. Great balance and easy drinking throughout in this malt dominant Abbey Dubbel.

Pours a deep hazy brown, with a small off white head that quickly disappears. Aromas of nuts, brown butter, earthy hops. Tastes of dried fruits, and herbal hops. Tasty.
bread, nuts, cheese, amber, clear, off white foam, light sweetness, lightly bitter, medium body, oily feel, fizzy, long finish,
Amber coloured and hazy. Has an off-white head, medim duration. Sweet aroma, notes of yeast and hops. Flavor starts moderate sweet, moderate bitter finish. Yeasty notes and light astringent. Fizzy.

33 cl bottle from LCBO, served cool in a tulip glass. 
App.:  Very cloudy copper with a large tan froth.
  
Aroma:  Rich caramel/toffee/treacle, lots of dark dried fruits punctuated by some brighter fruit notes, light lemon peel, dark bread crust, toast, rye bread crust, bordering on burnt sugar, light esters, a little alcohol, a little yeast and bread dough, quite nice;

Bottle, Hilpea hauki, Kalakierro 2013 -
Dullish red-orange with lasting head (after quite a lively opening). Aroma gives a hint of alcohol or maybe something phenolic. Heady and estery in the mouth, lots of apple, odd chemical spikes. Full palate, but lively carbonation. Not so brune, not so good either. Sweet estery mess. Disappointed, Dupont can do way better. Much much much better with all the yeast in - make sure you visit each glass twice. Softer and sweeter with the crud, actuall nice.Bumped taste score to 6 and overall to 12

330ml bottle.  Pours a slightly hazy reddish brown with a beige coloured head.  Aromas of candied fruit, woody notes, rye crisps, and a faint vinegar note.  The taste is mildly sour up front with dried fruit, under ripe plum, rye crisp, caramel, a faint taste that makes me think "cognac", dark bread crust, and a bitter dry metallic hop finish.

330mL bottle, lyckbow. Pours a hazy, muddy brown with a small beige head. The aroma is quite interesting, standard Belgian malts, not a lot of yeast, and a ton of fruity esters, strawberry, raspberry, and a touch of perfume. The flavour is even more impressive with large doses of fresh-tasting fruit, riding on an nice oily-feeling palate. The hops may be a bit faded owing to having sat around way too fucking long in an LCBO warehouse, but they come across as a sharp perfume-like element that is quite pleasing.  The alcohol is seamlessly hidden. Damn this one is impressive, I could drink a lot of this.

Bière qui demande beaucoup dintrospection...
Créée en 1986 pour donner une petite sur à la Moinette blonde, on doit
dire quand même que lon ne voit aucun lien de parenté...
Cette brune est sortie des livres de recettes ex abrupto 
Elle titre 8,5 % abv, et est faite avec 4 malts, cest très bien.
Couleur roux foncé. Clarté limpide. Bulles moyennes à fines partout.
Mousse beige claire qui reste crémeuse à 5 mm.
Arômes de café, rhum noir, réglisse, légère pointe de menthe.
1ère bouche à la texture soyeuse, qui présente un mélange café/tabac superbe,
avec du malt caramélisé. Larrière-bouche est très pleine, bien liée sur le
torréfié.
2ème nez de porto et whisky de campbeltown.
Bouche dune grande complexité bois/malt.
3ème bouche avec un mélange intéressant de saveurs, mais une rétro bouche 
un peu ardue et variable.
La longueur sinstalle bien.
La levure est dun niveau supérieur. Une très grande veine.
Mais rien ne nous étonnera à ce niveau dans cette superbe brasserie.
La longueur amplifie sur une complexité qui témoigne dun savoir-faire à 
toute épreuve, avec des arômes de moka au nez et la même chose au palais.
Un vrai régal sur ces 5ème et 6ème bouche. 
Une bière qui progresse dans une sorte dapothéose de feu dartifice.
La bouche devient très ferme, cest impressionnant et très proche de certains
imperial stout. 
La finale force le respect, parce quelle reprend tout et encore plus : noix, amandes,
noisettes, cafés, butterscotch, moka, réglisse, acajou, avec une pointe de girofle
et des fruits confits. 
Une bière qui progresse en exponentielle, cest déjà superbe, mais lorsquelle vous 
offre tout cela en finale  on en reste baba... 
Deux petits bémol :
1. Les arômes de départ un peu en-deçà
2. La 3ème bouche un peu curieuse

Subtle hints of toasty cocoa, fruits and spice in the flavour. Semi-dry finish and a nice warming. Hides the alcohol well and is rounded and drinkable. Nice Belgian brown.

Pours a deep raspberry colour, very little head.  Nose has some sweet fruit (strawberry?), and a spicy peppery character, along with floral notes, licorice and alcohol.  Medium full bodied, with a nice malty centre followed by some spicy yeasty flavours, finishes quite long and slightly sweet with alcohol warmth lingering.  Could do with a little more cabonation to refresh the palate but apart from that, very nice, and potent!

Wouldnt mind trying it with a year or so on it.

Cloudy, somewhere in between amber and burgundy with a beige head. Wonderful nose of honey, sweetness, red fruits, a bit of alcohol and slightly sour. 
The taste is pretty aggressive, also because of the strong carbonation, a mix of sour, a solid bitterness that would put quite a few stouts to shame, quite alcoholic and something grapefruit-like (bitterness with a sour touch at first), some caramel underneath it all.
Aftertaste: some alcoholic warmth and quite a bit of bitterness remain, some malts which didnt come through initially; the aftertaste is a bit lighter (watery would be too harsh a word) than some of its Dubbel peers. Still this reminds me of the better beers in its style and I would have loved it even more if it was a bit less bitter and if the sweetness of the nose would be reflected in the taste.

750 ml bottle into tulip glass, 2011 printed on cork.  Pours very hazy/cloudy reddish brown color with a 2-3 finger fluffy light khaki head with great retention, that reduces to a small cap that lingers.  Spotty foamy lacing clings to the glass.  Aromas of raisin, apple, pear, toast, caramel, pepper, clove, bread, earth, grass, hay, floral, and yeast spiciness.  Very nice aromas with good strength, balance, and complexity.  Taste of raisin, apple, toast, caramel, brown sugar, dark bread, pepper, clove, grass, hay, earth, light nuttiness, and yeast spiciness.  Lingering notes of light and dark fruits, toast, caramel, brown sugar, dark bread, pepper, clove, and earthy spiciness on the finish for a good bit.  Very nice flavor balance with a good amount of complexity; solid malt backbone; and no cloying flavors after the finish.  Medium-high carbonation and medium bodied; with a lightly slick, foamy, and fairly prickly mouthfeel that is nice.  Alcohol is extremely well hidden with almost zero warming noticed after the finish.  Overall this is an excellent Belgian strong dark ale.  Great amount of complexity and balance of flavors; and very smooth to sip on.  A very enjoyable offering.

Poured into a goblet. 2.011 on the cork.

3.5 A: Moderate to well hazed medium brown color. Two full fingers fo frothy tan head. Retention is good, but very little lacing is left.

3.0 S: Light roastiness, light toastiness, light floral. Fruitiness mainly in the form of plum and date, but also some raisin and fig. Mild malty sweetness. A little bit of nondescript spice from the yeast. Decent and pleasant, but no better than average.
